title: Biden’s Ethanol Boost Energizes Farmers, Worries Meat Producers
sub_head: Corn farmers and ethanol makers look for a bump in demand from summertime E15 sales; chicken producers fear higher grain costs
body:
The Biden administration’s plan to temporarily allow higher ethanol blends in gasoline is set to boost U.S. ethanol producers like Archer Daniels Midland Co . , Green Plains Inc . and Poet LLC, while lifting demand for farmers’ corn, agriculture industry executives and analysts said.
The Biden administration said that increasing use of gasoline with 15% ethanol, known as E15, over the summer months would help lower consumers’ fuel costs, which have climbed following Russia’s invasion of Ukraine. The decision is seen as a win for corn growers and ethanol-producing companies, though some groups said they fear it could further inflate food prices by making grain more expensive.
